t: John 9
A Man Born Blind Receives Sight
Now*p as Jesus*i passed by, He saw a man who was blind from birth.
And His disciples asked Him, saying, “Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?”
Jesus*p answered, “Neither*r this*r man*r nor*r his*r parents*r sinned,*r but*r that*r the*r works*r of*r God*r should*r be*r revealed*r in*r him.*r
I*r must*r work*r the*r works*r of*r Him*r who*r sent*r Me*r while*r it*r is*r day;*r the*ir night*r is*r coming*r when*r no*r one*r can*r work.*r
As*r long*r as*r I*r am*r in*r the*r world,*r I*r am*r the*r light*r of*r the*r world.”*r
When*p He had said these things, He spat on the ground and made clay with the saliva; and He anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay.
And He said to him, “Go,*r wash*r in*r the*r pool*r of*r Siloam”*r (which is translated, Sent). So he went and washed, and came back seeing.
Therefore*p the neighbors and those who previously had seen that he was blind said, “Is not this he who sat and begged?”
Some*p said, “This is he.” Others said,*i “He is like him.” He*p said, “I am he.”*i
Therefore*p they said to him, “How were your eyes opened?”
He*p answered and said, “A Man called Jesus made clay and anointed my eyes and said to me, ‘Go*r to*r the*r pool*r of*r Siloam*r and*r wash.’*r So I went and washed, and I received sight.”
Then*p they said to him, “Where is He?” He*p said, “I do not know.”
The Pharisees Excommunicate the Healed Man
They*p brought him who formerly was blind to the Pharisees.
Now it was a Sabbath when Jesus made the clay and opened his eyes.
Then the Pharisees also asked him again how he had received his sight. He said to them, “He put clay on my eyes, and I washed, and I see.”

Therefore*p some of the Pharisees said, “This Man is not from God, because He does not keep the Sabbath.” Others*p said, “How can a man who is a sinner do such signs?” And there was a division among them.
They*p said to the blind man again, “What do you say about Him because He opened your eyes?” He*p said, “He is a prophet.”
But*p the Jews did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind and received his sight, until they called the parents of him who had received his sight.
And they asked them, saying, “Is this your son, who you say was born blind? How then does he now see?”
His*p parents answered them and said, “We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind;
but by what means he now sees we do not know, or who opened his eyes we do not know. He is of age; ask him. He will speak for himself.”
His parents said these things*i because they feared the Jews, for the Jews had agreed already that if anyone confessed that*i He was*i Christ, he would be put out of the synagogue.
Therefore his parents said, “He is of age; ask him.”
So*p they again called the man who was blind, and said to him, “Give God the glory! We know that this Man is a sinner.”
He*p answered and said, “Whether He is a sinner or*i not*i I do not know. One thing I know: that though I was blind, now I see.”
Then*p they said to him again, “What did He do to you? How did He open your eyes?”
He*p answered them, “I told you already, and you did not listen. Why do you want to hear it*i again? Do you also want to become His disciples?”
Then*p they reviled him and said, “You are His disciple, but we are Moses’ disciples.
We know that God spoke to Moses; as*i for*i this fellow,*i we do not know where He is from.”
The*p man answered and said to them, “Why, this is a marvelous thing, that you do not know where He is from; yet He has opened my eyes!
Now we know that God does not hear sinners; but if anyone is a worshiper of God and does His will, He hears him.
Since the world began it has been unheard of that anyone opened the eyes of one who was born blind.
If this Man were not from God, He could do nothing.”
They*p answered and said to him, “You were completely born in sins, and are you teaching us?” And they cast him out.
True Vision and True Blindness
Jesus*p heard that they had cast him out; and when He had found him, He said to him, “Do*r you*r believe*r in*r the*r Son*r of*r God?”*r
He*p answered and said, “Who is He, Lord, that I may believe in Him?”
And*p Jesus said to him, “You*r have*r both*r seen*r Him*r and*r it*r is*r He*r who*r is*r talking*r with*r you.”*r
Then*p he said, “Lord, I believe!” And he worshiped Him.
And*p Jesus said, “For*r judgment*r I*r have*r come*r into*r this*r world,*r that*r those*r who*r do*r not*r see*r may*r see,*r and*r that*r those*r who*r see*r may*r be*r made*r blind.”*r
Then*p some*i of the Pharisees who were with Him heard these words, and said to Him, “Are we blind also?”
Jesus*p said to them, “If*r you*r were*r blind,*r you*r would*r have*r no*r sin;*r but*r now*r you*r say,*r ‘We*r see.’*r Therefore*r your*r sin*r remains.*r
